title: Understanding the Galvanic Cell
text: In a galvanic cell, the anode is where oxidation occurs, and the cathode is where reduction occurs. Identify which metal is oxidized and which is reduced.

title: Identify the Half-Reactions
text: Look at the standard reduction potential table. Find the half-reactions for zinc and copper. Remember, the anode reaction will be the reverse of the reduction reaction.

title: Write the Anode Half-Reaction
text: The anode is zinc. Write the oxidation half-reaction for zinc.

title: Write the Cathode Half-Reaction
text: The cathode is copper. Write the reduction half-reaction for copper.

title: Calculate the Standard Cell Potential
text: Use the standard reduction potentials from the table. The standard cell potential is the difference between the cathode and anode potentials.

title: Find the Standard Reduction Potentials
text: From the table, find the standard reduction potential for copper and zinc.

title: Calculate Ecell
text: Use the formula $$Ecell=E(cathode)-E(anode)$$ to find the standard cell potential.
